title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Shipley G (2024). sets: Python-ish Set Functions R. R package version 0.0.1, https://pythonicr.github.io/sets/, https://github.com/pythonicr/sets.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sets: Python-ish Set Functions in R},   author = {Garrett Shipley},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1,     https://pythonicr.github.io/sets/},   url = {https://github.com/pythonicr/sets}, }

title: Python-ish Set Functions in R
text: sets R package provides comprehensive set functions performing set operations, inspired Python’s set methods. package aims make set operations R intuitive accessible, especially users familiar Python. functions sets leverage data.table checkmate packages ensure efficient reliable set operations.

title: Python-ish Set Functions in R
text: can install sets package directly GitHub.
code: # Install devtools if you haven't already install.packages("devtools")  # Install sets package from GitHub devtools::install_github("pythonicr/sets")

title: Python-ish Set Functions in R
text: examples demonstrating use functions provided sets package.

title: Python-ish Set Functions in R
text: sets_difference function returns elements x sets.
code: library(sets)  # Compute the difference between sets difference <- sets_difference(c(1, 2, 3), c(2, 3, 4)) print(difference) #> [1] 1

what: Check if Two Sets are Equal
title: Python-ish Set Functions in R
text: sets_equal function checks two sets x y contain elements.
code: # Check if sets are equal equal <- sets_equal(c(1, 2, 3), c(3, 1, 2)) print(equal) #> [1] TRUE

title: Python-ish Set Functions in R
text: sets_intersection function returns common elements sets.
code: # Compute the intersection of sets intersection <- sets_intersection(c(1, 2, 3), c(2, 3, 4), c(3, 4, 5)) print(intersection) #> [1] 3

title: Python-ish Set Functions in R
text: sets_isdisjoint function checks two sets elements common.
code: # Check if sets are disjoint disjoint1 <- sets_isdisjoint(c(1, 2, 3), c(4, 5, 6)) disjoint2 <- sets_isdisjoint(c(1, 2, 3), c(3, 4, 5)) print(disjoint1) #> [1] TRUE print(disjoint2) #> [1] FALSE

what: Check if a Set is a Subset of Another Set
title: Python-ish Set Functions in R
text: sets_issubset function checks elements x y.
code: # Check if a set is a subset subset <- sets_issubset(c(1, 2), c(1, 2, 3)) print(subset) #> [1] TRUE

what: Check if a Set is a Superset of Another Set
title: Python-ish Set Functions in R
text: sets_issuperset function checks elements y x.
code: # Check if a set is a superset superset <- sets_issuperset(c(1, 2, 3), c(2, 3)) print(superset) #> [1] TRUE

what: Compute the Symmetric Difference Between Sets
title: Python-ish Set Functions in R
text: sets_symmetric_difference function returns elements either x y .
code: # Compute the symmetric difference between sets symmetric_difference <- sets_symmetric_difference(c(1, 2, 3), c(3, 4, 5)) print(symmetric_difference) #> [1] 1 2 4 5

title: Python-ish Set Functions in R
text: sets_union function returns elements present sets.
code: # Compute the union of sets union <- sets_union(c(1, 2, 3), c(3, 4, 5)) print(union) #> [1] 1 2 3 4 5

title: Python-ish Set Functions in R
text: welcome contributions sets package. suggestions, bug reports, want contribute code, please open issue submit pull request GitHub repository. isdisjoint issubset issuperset union intersection difference symmetric_difference
